185455403.review:
We can mock this game all we like for having poor writing, awful melee combat, and generally questionable storylines, especially when you put it alongside other titans of the genre, but the reality is that Skyrim- all these years later- is still a profoundly good game. I tend to give full reviews on Steam, but it's not really necessary here- you all know what Skyrim is. But no game has a world like Skyrim; is it 'wide as an ocean, deep as a puddle'? Yes, most definitely. But it's a very pretty puddle, and one of the most immersive worlds out there.
I have racked up hundreds upon hundreds of hours in this world on other platforms, and each time is always wonderful. Only now am I delving into modding, which is something everyone should try, because it can really change the game in ways you wouldn't expect, from overhauled systems, to impressive visuals, to all new quests.
Yes, the writing is bad, as I said. But I won't lie and say I don't enjoy many of Skyrim's quests. They don't have the profundity of a lot of other RPGs, and don't present the same true dilemmas, but they're enjoyable, and that's okay for what this game is.
Skyrim's value is its world, atmosphere, sense of adventure, and build variety, and it's a testament to this game's monolithic status that even now, we still play this game.

185421333.review: I love the Elder Scrolls, but Skyrim as it is would be best with mods. Bethesda however will just keep breaking mod load-orders for no reason, as any update causes many mods to just stop functioning. I think that the last update that did this was very late 2022, but by that time, the modding community has mostly retired. Nexus Mods is trying to keep it alive, but in order to get a good load order you have 3 bad options. 1st is to follow tutorials in order to downgrade to a version that many mods still work. 2nd is to use the in-game Creation Club which is still just as buggy as you would expect Bethesda to be. 3rd is to pay an online subscription to Nexus Mods in order to get an auto-install feature to go along with your mod organizer. On top of this, the original version (now referenced as Oldrim in the modding community) has been removed from Steam, so that nobody can buy Skyrim without the Creation Club present. I wish that they just helped the modding community out, as it is what has kept players in love with the game, but they actually just regret the lack of monetization that they had put into it from the start. Many sub-par mods on the Creation Club are being charged for, and the Nexus counterparts are a much higher quality anyway. If you really want to play some Skyrim with a modern twist, then just hit a couple mods in the Creation Club that are free (many of the better Nexus mods have made it in, and don't cost money), or download a mod manager and keep the number of mods low. Either way, make a backup folder just in case, especially for any save files that you are attached to.

185372826.review:
In a way, it feels pointless to give this a review. Everyone knows what Skyrim is, most people with a PC have played it at least once. A review is unlikely to sway anyone new, so why bother? Well, I leave this review in protest to the modern state of Bethesda. This game was made with passion, with a love for organic exploration and a respect for the player's time.  I didn't appreciate Skyrim as much as Oblivion, having grown up with that first, but after recent duds like Fallout 76 and Starfield, I've gone back to Bethesda's older entries to remind myself it never used to be all bad.

Where Starfield bogs you down with needless loading screens and procedural generated slop that you forget 5 minutes after 'exploring' it, Skyrim has hand-crafted dungeons, questlines of varying quality, a wealth of weapons and armours, an amazing DLC in the form of Dragonborn, and mod support that remains the best-in-industry. 

It honestly makes me sad how good revisiting this in 2025 has been, because it reminds me that these good days of Bethesda are well and truly gone as they chase lazy writing, procedural generation and identical prefabs, and an even greater reliance on radiant quests.

Skyrim, you are beloved for good reason.

Desde 2013, quando jogava no Xbox 360, negligenciei completamente esse jogo. Mal sabia eu que estava adiando uma das experiências mais incríveis do mundo dos videogames. Hoje, com quase 100 horas de jogo, percebo que ainda estou longe de alcançar 100% do conteúdo. Já finalizei a história principal de Dragonborn e completei várias missões paralelas, mas parece que o jogo está apenas começando.

Para quem tem tempo e paciência para explorar mundos vivos, ricos em detalhes e histórias em cada canto, Skyrim é um prato cheio. Definitivamente, uma verdadeira obra-prima. Em 2025, é raro ver jogos feitos com tanto cuidado e dedicação. Hoje, apenas estúdios como FromSoftware, Rockstar Games, Capcom (Resident Evil) e Naughty Dog conseguem manter esse nível de qualidade — e ainda assim, são empresas que demandam anos para lançar algo digno.

185349260.review:
If you've ever wondered what it feels like to shout at a dragon until it falls out of the sky or stack hundreds of cabbages in a stranger's house without facing legal consequences, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is the game for you.

Bethesda's magnum opus throws you into the shoes of the Dragonborn—a hero with a destiny so vague even they need a journal update to keep track of it. Do you save the world from Alduin the World-Eater, or do you spend 30 hours becoming the ultimate blacksmith only to realize you've somehow turned every bandit camp into a walking loot piñata? The choice is yours, and that's where Skyrim shines—or breaks, depending on how many mods you’ve installed.

Combat is a symphony of chaos. You can wield a flaming sword in one hand and a spell in the other—or dual-wield wheels of cheese if you're committed enough to immersion. Want to become a stealth archer? Don’t worry, you will—it’s Skyrim’s unofficial starter pack.

And the world itself? Oh, it’s gorgeous. From the towering peaks of the Throat of the World to the bustling streets of Whiterun, Skyrim is the perfect place to get lost—both metaphorically and literally. But beware: NPCs have a sixth sense for your mischief. Drop one fork, and suddenly Nazeem is lecturing you about the Cloud District like you’re the problem.

Let’s not forget the bugs. Sure, a mammoth might occasionally fall from the sky, and Lydia might decide her true calling is blocking every doorway, but it’s all part of the charm. Bethesda didn’t give us a flawless game—they gave us a playground where chaos is the main feature.

In conclusion, Skyrim is less of a game and more of an experience. Whether you're Fus-Ro-Dah-ing a bandit off a cliff, adopting a dog that somehow survives dragon attacks, or shouting at a guard who definitely used to be an adventurer like you, Skyrim delivers unforgettable moments. Just remember to save often—especially if you’re teetering on a ledge, balancing 400 pounds of dragon bones and sweet rolls.

9/10—would steal a sweet roll again.

Bazı oyunlar vardır ki, sadece bir eğlence değil, bir hatıradır. Skyrim, benim için işte böyle bir eserdir. Çocukluğumun oyunu, hayal gücümü besleyen, beni bambaşka diyarlara sürükleyen, keşfetmekten asla yorulmadığım bir başyapıt… Ve şüphesiz, benim için Top 1!

Bu diyar, yalnızca bir harita değil, bir destanın sayfalarıdır. Ejderhaların gökleri titrettiği, kadim büyülerin unutulmuş dehlizlerde saklandığı, her köyün, her karakterin, her maceranın anlatacak bir hikâyesi olduğu bir âlemdir. Bir Dovahkiin olarak doğup, efsaneye dönüşmek… İşte tam da bu yüzden Skyrim, yıllar geçse de eskimez.

Kimi zaman bir hırsız, kimi zaman bir savaşçı, bazen de bir büyücü oldum. Dağların zirvesinde, fırtınaların ortasında, karanlık mahzenlerin derinliklerinde kendi hikâyemi yazdım. Sonsuz özgürlük ve keşif hissi, onu benzersiz kılan en büyük nimettir.

Evet, kusurları vardır; nice hata, nice gariplik yaşatır. Ama bu hatalar bile oyunun efsaneleşmesine engel olamaz! Skyrim, yalnızca bir oyun değil, bir neslin hatırasıdır. Ve benim için her zaman bir numara olarak kalacaktır.

🔹 Puan: 11/10
🔹 Hüküm: Bir oyun değil, bir efsane!

Things I've done in Skyrim (in no particular order):

- Got married.
- Adopted six children.

- Adopted a stray dog.

- Used my Jesus powers to slay dragons and save the world.
- Became a werewolf.
- Cured a great warrior's spirit of lycanthropy.
- Became a vampire hunter.
- Immediately gave up being a vampire hunter because vampires gave me cooler gear.
- Betrayed the vampires and gained the ability to summon a skeleton horse and a zombie dragon.
- Joined an organized crime syndicate.
- Killed the leader of said organization, selling my soul to an evil god.
- Became the leader of a criminal organization and restored them to their former glory.
- Joined the cult of assassins.
- Hugged someone's dead mother in a coffin. - Killed a burnt chicken nugget with a cursed dagger. - Killed the Emperor. - Killed the man who asked me to kill the Emperor. - Got 30,000 coins after killing the man who paid me to kill the Emperor. - Never spoke to my friends from the Brotherhood again. - Entered the magic academy. - Was chosen by mysterious wizards to save the academy. - Found a flying magic ball. - Killed people who tried to use the flying magic ball for their own purposes. - Became the director of the academy. - Joined the blue team. - Thought it would be funny to join the red team after killing their leader, so I switched sides. - Defeated the blue team. - Defeated the Ancient Tree. - Came to another continent to learn about another Jesus. - Killed another Skyrim Jesus because there's only room for one of us in this world.
- Stole a horse I'd already stolen.
- Killed the guy I stole a horse from because I wanted that horse.
- Killed a woman I passed on the road because she insulted me.
- Soaked in a hot spring with a bunch of hunters.
- Got drunk.
- Started multiple bar fights.
- Helped two lizards get married.
- Had tea with a crazy guy in a cool suit.
- Took 1000 coins and threw them in the river because I wanted to see where they'd end up.
- Blackmailed A LOT of people. A LOT.
- Killed a bunch of guards because they made fun of me stealing sweet rolls. THIS IS IMPORTANT!
- Walked on stage during an execution because he wanted to take a necklace from a man. - Was put on the wanted list for walking on stage during an execution. - Gave money to the poor (After throwing 1000 coins into the river). - Killed a man on his way to town and threw his body into the river because he wanted to see where it would end up. - Killed several non-dangerous animals because he knew he could. - Reunited Scooby with Shaggy. - Gave Vorstag a lot of fireball scrolls. - Regretted giving him all those scrolls. - Stole all the books from the Mage Academy library because my home library was empty. - Stole absolutely every book I could find because I was obsessed with my idea. - Got addicted to drugs. - Became a bard. - Downloaded a mod because becoming a bard made it impossible for me to sing. – Arrested for performing “Age of Oppression” at the Blue Palace.
– Escaped from prison multiple times.
– Became a heavy drinker.
– Constance Michel regretted letting me adopt the children.
– Killed a horse and threw its body in the river because he wanted to see where it would end up.
– Took people to see the Giants to watch them get clubbed over the head.
– Told the children I would play tag with them, then left.
– Told my daughter she could bring home a mud crab as a pet, but my son wouldn’t allow it.
– Told my children I had a gift for them, but gave them nothing. They need to know the bitterness of life.
– Cooked food for the whole family and set the table properly.
– Gave Vorstag some food, then ate the rest in front of my children.
– Gave my children 1,000 gold.
-Filled my basement with skooma
-Collected all the jars of insects.
-Was wanted in all the holdings for the same crime.
-Took eloquence lessons from a Khajiit merchant.
-Purchased goods from him at favorable prices.

Is this what you wanted, Todd?

12 out of 10

185231961.review: Skyrim has always been one of the worst video games of all time. My criticisms? Just watch any Starfield review video. Skyrim is literally the same video game with worse graphics, just like every piece of slop Bethesda has ever released. This game, in 2025, is as bad as it was in 2011. Stuttering? Of course. Forced motion blur? Yep. Locked framerate, tied to physics engine? Why not. Still bad graphics, still bad story, still tons of loading screens just to go anywhere, still terrible animations, still bad writing, still bad voice acting, still bad art design, just bad. Combat? Worst in the genre. Magic system? A joke. Exploration? Great as long as you like looking at lots of low-res grey pixels. That's just the entire game. Low res textures interspersed with lower-res mismatched textures, all grey. Skyrim has always been bad. Even now that people are criticizing it's clone Starslop, they still claim Skyrim is great, or that it WAS great, or that it's good, or whatever. No. It's bad. Always has been. It's not even mediocre, and it never has been. If you can even call loadscreenrim an open-world game, there were still better options in 2011. Hell, oblivion was literally just skyrim except not quite as bad. GTA 4 existed years before the originally release. Hell, why are we pretending this is a 2011 game? The title clearly says "special edition" and the release date says "2016." Witcher 3 had been out for a year by the time this released. I genuinely hate this pathetic excuse of a video game. Is it bad by 2025 standards? Obviosuly. But, important to note is this: it was bad by 2011 standards. I was there in 2011. It was bad. Even worse than it is now. At the end of the day, they refused to even give us an FOV slider, even in their remastered "special edition." Like, what more can I say? Every design decision Bethesda has ever made has been bad, and Todd Howard has never made a good video game. He most certainly never will.

You already know what this game is. It is fantastic - a seemingly endless open world with an interesting narrative with in-depth side quests to match. Two-handed combat could be improved as it is not particuarly satisfying. Stealth/magic is a tad overpowered and ocassionally enemies will be far stronger than they should be. Any shortcoming in this games content can be fixed by the large amounts of mods on offer from the workshop and programs such as the nexus mod manager. This is one of the easiest games to mod and can still run with 100+ mods if you know what youre doing. The Default menues are clunky and optimised for a controller, however this again can be modded out with the help of SkyUI or other mods similar.
Highly recommend.

185190528.review:
Un gran juego la verdad, al cual siempre termino volviendo sin importar cuanto tiempo lo haya dejado de jugar. tiene sus bugs, si. (Bethesda, que esperaban?) pero eso es lo de menos, ya que el juego cuenta con historias diversas y el importante factor que hace a skyrim un gran juego: la libertad. Normalmente en cualquier juego rpg tienes una mision lineal que seguir para desbloquear cosas y personajes, pero en skyrim eso es lo de menos. Con la cantidad de misiones secundarias las cuales pasan a ser principales hasta cierto punto y en el orden en el cual puedes completarlas hace que no te sientas forzado a seguir todo de golpe, y darte un tiempo para hacer otras actividades o misiones. Tambien la libertad de que puedes hacer cualquier build con tu personaje y divertirte con ella (Me encanta la magia). 

Tambien lo que podemos destacar es la creatividad de la comunidad al crear mods para el juego que agregan o incluso mejoran cosas que en el juego base flaquean un poco (el escalado de la magia en el vanilla no es tan bueno que digamos...) lo que añade mas horas de diversión al probar distintas modificaciones y encontrar lo que mas se adapte a tu estilo de juego. 

Lo otro que me encantaria destacar es que a pesar de ser un juego bastante viejo (15 años si no me equivoco) la verdad es que casi ni se nota, ya que Skyrim hace un gran trabajo a la hora de crear un mundo inmersivo y un paisajismo que hay veces me ha dejado sorprendido, las graficas son bastante hermosas y a veces tiendes a olvidar que este juego no es tan moderno como el resto de los rpg actuales.

si te gustan los juegos RPG en los cuales quieres tener libertad con que build hacer tu personaje y su trama, entonces Skyrim es tu juego. No comente mucho de las misiones ni la historia para no hacer spoilers, ya que es mejor que los nuevos jugadores lo experimenten por su cuenta.

Gracias Bethesda por crear esta obra maestra!

185176308.review:
老滚5，距今已有13载51天，特别版也距今8载64天，我依然忘不了那个初三的冬天，还用着破烂电脑的我，steam还没有注册的我，在当时盗版网站找到老滚5的盗版文件，下载后陪我渡过了一整个冬天，并且在之后的3，4年里一直伴着我，只要想到我就会玩。在高一时期，我终于买了正版来补票，加上玩盗版的时长，大概也有个2000小时了。在天际的旅行重开过许多次，依然喜欢当做一个拥有信仰的诺德人，期待死后于英灵殿的辉煌，在无数次重开中，基本每一次新档都是我回归开启的，每个档的游玩时间有多有少，最多的是按照网上的全攻略进行了全收集，虽然这个档已经找不到了，但依然刻在我的记忆里。同时，我钦佩于老滚剧情上的叙述能力，不仅是主线，还有一些长段支线，即使是支线也没有糊弄玩家。比如帝国与风暴斗篷之间，不是黑与白的对立，而是灰与灰的争斗，这是我过去时期想不到的叙事方式。还有更对，黑暗兄弟会，盗贼工会，战友团，黎明守卫，有太多太多可探索的东西了。
我打过mod，那些东西让老滚的体验更好了，也修复了官方一直没有修复的BUG，同时增加了更多的剧情，让老滚至今都很有活力，但我更热爱原版的老滚，因为他是我游戏的启蒙，没了他，我不会对游戏感兴趣。
即使是现在，星空的失败，让陶德的声望大跌，但我依然相信B社能够在未来的老滚6交出完美的大卷，因为他是陶德，过去挽救了B社的人，因为他们是贝塞斯达，开创了老滚IP的公司。
是的，我期待，那，陶德，我的《The Elder Scrolls VI》呢？
                                     —于重温滚5主题曲有感

185138240.review:
Impérial, Sombrage, voleur, assassin, loup-garou, vampire, neutre ou héros, partisan des daedras, des aedras ou d'aucun, explorateur ou justicier, mode survie ou mode normal, ce jeu est tout simplement magnifique, que ce soit les paysages, les personnages ou les quêtes. Les cinématiques de combat sont superbes, et la diversité des personnages que l'on peut incarner fait de ce jeu un jeu nouveau à chaque nouvelle partie lancée si l'on décide de changer de rôle play.
Personnellement, lors de ma première partie j'ai beaucoup lu les livres pour connaître le passé d'Elder Scrolls (n'ayant jamais joué aux jeux précédents) et ceci afin de choisir un camp dans lequel me battre, j'ai donc joué rejoint les impériaux, aux valeurs altruistes avides de justice et d'honneur (d'où mon rattachement aux Compagnons et donc mon côté loup-garou également).
J'ai fini ma partie, avec un souvenir merveilleux.
Puis j'ai voulu lancer une autre partie avec un personnage tout autre, afin d'incarner un role play tout autre: voleuse. J'ai été surprise de voir la diversité du jeu: de nouvelles quêtes sont apparues, un nouveau décor, de nouveau amis, de nouveaux ennemis, une nouvelle manière de penser, bref, un autre jeu.
Je recommande à 200% et invite même les joueurs à incarner plusieurs personnages dans de nombreuses parties afin de profiter pleinement de tout ce que Skyrim a à offrir.

185129911.review:
La primera vez que jugué Skyrim fue en un Xbox 360 hace ya una década y media. Desde ese momento se volvió un juego infaltable en mi biblioteca. Es fácil olvidarse el tiempo que pasa uno en el mapa, caminando de un lugar a otro, hablando con los personajes, oyendo los comentarios de los seguidores, encontrando secretos, daedras, armas, encantando, subiendo de nivel, comprando, vendiendo, subiendo montañas a caballo. En fin, puedes hacer casi cualquier tipo de rol dentro de Skyrim, aunque obviamente hay que ser arquero con sigilo para experimentar la verdadera esencia del juego. Tan bueno es que Bethesda ha logrado vender el mismo juego desde hace 15 años en diferentes consolas, ediciones, ports, y demás.

Si tienes un equipo suficientemente poderoso, te recomiendo que busques en Wabbajack o en Nexus modpacks que te harán empezar todo de nuevo en juegos totalmente diferentes. Skyrim es el sueño de los modders y de los que disfrutamos romper los juegos en sus limites. Por cierto mi modpack favorito hasta ahora es LoreRim 2.0.

Sea como sea, Skyrim es un clásico y se puede disfrutar sin importar la edad, genero o color de cabello.

En síntesis
☑ Hay que tenerlo
☐ Comprar en rebaja
☐ Para jugar con amigos
☐ Si te sobra dinero
☐ Ni regalado

185128016.review: I LOVE THE ELDER SCROLLS SERIES

185125538.review:
Skyrim es una obra maestra atemporal. Llevo jugando desde su lanzamiento en PS3, luego en PS4, y ahora en PC, y puedo decir con confianza que este juego nunca deja de sorprenderme.

Desde los vastos paisajes montañosos hasta las épicas batallas contra dragones, cada rincón de Skyrim está lleno de detalles y aventuras que te sumergen por completo en su mundo. El sistema de habilidades, las innumerables misiones secundarias y las decisiones que moldean la historia principal hacen que cada partida sea única.

Además, la comunidad de mods en PC lleva la experiencia a otro nivel, añadiendo desde mejoras gráficas hasta nuevas historias y mecánicas. Sin embargo, incluso sin mods, Skyrim sigue siendo un juego impresionante que puedo recomendar a cualquiera que disfrute de los RPG de mundo abierto.

En pocas palabras, Skyrim es un juego que siempre encuentro motivos para volver a jugar. Ya sea para explorar un nuevo rincón del mapa, probar un estilo de juego diferente o simplemente revivir momentos épicos, siempre hay algo nuevo que descubrir.

🎮 Calificación: 10/10 - Una experiencia que nunca envejece.

185122869.review: Отрубать головы гpебанным некромантам в этом великолепии одно удовольствие. Чистейший бриллиант. 10/10. Рекомендую для полного погружения и "раскрытия" игры играть в режиме выживания. Единственное опечалило, что дизайн многих одноручных мечей мягко сказать - калл: что орочий, даэдрический - лучше бы двуручный, который выглядит как одноручный и сделали бы одноручным, а эбонитовый меч это вообще позор, кто с этим недоразумением вообще бегать будет? Но это по сути единственное что не слишком так сказать понравилось, в остальном - всё идеально, и расскажу почему в конце полного моего прохождения, в этой игре я хочу жить, что и делаю сейчас. Скайрим вечен.

185055287.review:
I bought and played the original game and all expansions on and offline for countless hours since its original release in 2011 and came back to it many times over the years, mainly to mod the game and crash the engine beyond repair, to learn under the incredibly strict master that is called "trial and error", over and over again.
Many years later, the nexus modding community finally fixed the game engine for the developers...
I implemented many mods to my loadouts and by the end of my journey, I had to become very picky, not to reach the loadout limit. I created a few mods, scripts, textures and meshes as well, kindling my creative side as part of the Nexus.

I broke my game with it more times than I can count and had to start over my play through so many times, I cannot remember. I have spent more hours in third party tools and TES5EDIT to fix mod conflicts and overwrite them manually by hand, than to actually play the game (until I learned how to use scripts).
It was a truly harrowing experience, but the blissful delight to enabling me to enact my role playing fantasies was most satisfying.

I will remember the modded game as one of the most immersive games I ever played, being so perfectly tailored to my tastes and fantasies. The graphics in this came can be pushed up to a scale that will blow every AAA title you know out of the water. You have never seen how a world crafted with modded graphics relying on ENB filters, super high polygon count and handcrafted textures and animations tied to incredible NPC behavior scripts, a perfectly crafted world challenging world, realistic and fun combat and character progression looks and feels like.

But enough with my rambling, I only wrote this to indulge in reminiscences, but you may see it as my long overdue homage to the community and their incredible efforts and development of what one should have expected from the developers themselves, though I do understand that one cannot pass on being provided with an army of fans to fix their problems, who work free of charge for one's benefit, while not having to share the laurels with them.

Take care now and have fun!

184977426.review:
This game is a 2016 re-master of a 2011 game. One facet of this 2011 game that people ABSOLUTELY HATED was that the game would only autosave after you entered or exited a building. Not after a quest was completed, not after surviving a bandit ambush, not even after killing a dragon. You would frequently lose LOADS of progress because you forgot to quicksave whilst wandering through the expanse of skyrim. And yet, for some reason, bethesda decided NOT to polish up the autosave function. I, personally, have lost easily 3 hours of progress on my most recent playthrough simply because I hadn't entered a building in a long time, died, and went back to an autosave from 45 minutes ago. This has happened multiple times.

So now, playing this in the year of our Lord 2025, we are still playing a game who's design is from 2005.

Get it, its a fun game, but MASH F5 after every single little thing or get a mod that autosaves for you.

[h1]Тодде, я не прощу тобі того, що ти заполонив моє серденько своєю творчістю[/h1]

Немає сенсу розповідати про цю гру, ніби ніхто не знає, що це таке. Три роки тому я придбав цю гру на своє день народження (ну якщо бути правильним, то пізніше, коли з'явилась знижка) і мої перші спроби на проходження не були успішними. Був перший захід, залишився лише сейв з похідом до Сідобородих, другий захід провалився на початку. Ось знову, з свіжою головою через 2 роки перерви я знову спробував пройти цю гру. Це була [b][u]фатальна[/u][/b] помилка...

Повністю відкритий для вивчення світ дозволив мені виконувати всі квести, які попадалися лише мені під руку, щоб я міг розкачати свою головну героїню (ніхуя собі, всі вахуї) та покращити свої вміння. Проходження було максимально чіллове за непомітного вампіра-лучника за лісного ельфа. Сказати, що я отримав від цього нереальну насолоду, це не сказати нічого! Як для першого проходження тотально рекомендую!

Шкода, що моя система почала барахлити і Скайрим періодично вирішив вилітати на стіл, але це не зупинить мене грати знову в цей шедевр, але вже з рекомендованим другом модом під назвою "Requiem - The Roleplaying Overhaul". Сподіваюсь, я зможу зповна насолодитися тією ж атмосферою гри, але з нотками змін...

184969042.review:
Once you played Skyrim for the first time, there is no going back. 

I don't even know how to sum up this game in a unique way. There are plenty of better games out there, but Skyrim is unique in it's freedom to do whatever you want to when you want to, and in having bugs that are more comical than they are game breaking. 

You can ignore the entire main quest with no consequences and live out your dreams as a farmer. You can spend your time wandering the wilds while listening to music (just watch out for the bears). Which I would recommend as the scenery has no right to be this stunning. 

The lore is easily accessible to. The story line and characters are somehow complex and basic at the same time. The side quests are engaging, and the combat is easy to learn. 

There is a reason why people keep playing it a decade later.

184941055.review:
*The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim* è, senza dubbio, uno dei giochi più belli che abbia mai giocato. Mi ha regalato un’esperienza unica grazie alla sua libertà, al mondo incredibilmente dettagliato e a una storia epica che ti cattura dall’inizio.  

Cosa ho amato di Skyrim

La libertà di scelta
La cosa che più mi ha colpito è stata la libertà assoluta: potevo scegliere di seguire la trama principale o ignorarla per esplorare il mondo. Diventare un eroe, un mago oscuro, un ladro o semplicemente vagare tra le montagne innevate era completamente nelle mie mani.  

Un mondo vivo e dettagliato
Ogni angolo di Skyrim mi ha sorpreso. Villaggi, foreste, montagne… tutto è curato nei minimi dettagli. I cambiamenti climatici e il ciclo giorno/notte hanno reso l’esperienza ancora più immersiva, e ogni viaggio mi sembrava un’avventura unica.  

Storie epiche ovunque
Oltre alla trama principale, le missioni secondarie sono incredibili. Le gilde come la Confraternita Oscura o i Maghi di Winterhold hanno storie così belle che spesso le ho trovate più avvincenti della storia principale. E ogni decisione aveva un peso, rendendo il tutto ancora più coinvolgente.  

Il sistema di combattimento e crescita
Adoro come Skyrim mi abbia permesso di personalizzare il mio personaggio. Ho potuto combattere come volevo, con spade, archi o incantesimi, e gli *Urli del Drago* hanno aggiunto un tocco epico ai combattimenti.  

La musica che fa sognare
La colonna sonora è qualcosa che non dimenticherò mai. Il tema *Dragonborn* è pura epicità e ha reso ogni momento ancora più speciale.  

Un gioco che non finisce mai
Grazie alla comunità di modder, il gioco è sempre fresco. Ho potuto aggiungere contenuti, miglioramenti grafici e persino nuove missioni, mantenendo Skyrim interessante anche dopo anni.  

Perché lo considero meraviglioso
Skyrim mi ha fatto sentire parte di un mondo vivo, dove ogni decisione e ogni avventura avevano un significato. È un’esperienza che va oltre il semplice giocare: è un viaggio che ti resta nel cuore. Per me, è stato molto più di un gioco… è stata un’avventura indimenticabile.

[b] 10/10 - 🌟 Chef-d'œuvre intemporel [/b] 🌟

🎮 [i]Skyrim[/i], c’est plus qu’un jeu : c’est une [b]expérience de vie[/b]. Dès les premières notes du thème principal, vous sentez que vous êtes sur le point de vivre une aventure épique. Et quelle aventure ! 🐉✨


🏔️ [b]Les points forts[/b] :

[list]
     [*]🌍Un monde vivant et immersif :
    Chaque recoin de Bordeciel raconte une histoire. Que ce soit en explorant des ruines nordiques, en admirant les aurores boréales ou en discutant avec les habitants des villages, tout respire la vie.

     [*]🗡️Une liberté absolue :
    Vous voulez être un héros ? Un voleur ? Un mage ? Tous à la fois ? Skyrim vous laisse choisir. Vous pouvez passer des heures à chasser des 🦋 ou à terroriser des bandits, et tout reste incroyablement amusant.

   [*]  🛠️Des mods pour une durée de vie infinie :
    La communauté a transformé Skyrim en un jeu sans fin. Des ajouts hilarants aux extensions dignes de développeurs professionnels, le modding rend chaque partie unique.

     [*]🎵Une bande-son légendaire :
    La musique de Jeremy Soule est un véritable hymne à l’aventure. Essayez de ne pas frissonner en entendant [i]Dragonborn... (Spoiler : c’est impossible.)[/i]
[/list]


💡 [b]Les anecdotes[/b] :
[list]
[*]💥 J'ai crié [b]"Fus Ro Dah"[/b] sur un pont suspendu et regardé mes ennemis voler dans le vide.
[*]🐾 J'ai adopté un chien, planté des choux et construit une maison.
[*]🧙‍♂️ Lors d'une quête magique, j’ai voulu expérimenter un nouveau sort. Résultat : j’ai invoqué un poulet spectral qui a décidé de me suivre partout. Il n’a servi à rien, mais bon, il était mignon. 🐔✨
[*]🤣 Un jour, je me suis transformé accidentellement en loup-garou en plein marché. Résultat : panique générale et une dizaine de gardes aux trousses. J’ai dû passer la nuit à me cacher dans un tonneau. 🛢️🐺
[/list]


✅ [b]Verdict[/b] :
[list]
[*]✨ Skyrim, c’est le jeu que je rêverais de redécouvrir pour la première fois. Même après des centaines d’heures, il me surprend encore. C’est une œuvre intemporelle qui mérite sa place au panthéon des jeux vidéo.

[*]🏞️ Bordeciel vous appelle, [i]Dovahkiin[/i]. Répondez à l’appel.

[*]⚠️ [b](Avertissement : Peut entraîner une perte de sommeil et un désintérêt temporaire pour toute autre forme de vie sociale.) [/b]

[/list]

The first time I ever played this game, it was because my friend had told me in it, you can get a jester's outfit. I love jesters, because I myself am a massive clown, so I started playing this game in determination to get the outfit. Along the way to getting the outfit, I got sidetracked and immersed in the world this game built, and found myself wanting to do nothing but explore the seemingly endless things to do in this game. I only started this game for a single set of armor. I didn't expect it to become such a massive stress reliever for me, I didn't expect to fall in love with the characters or the story or even the game. Now, every time I boot up Skyrim, it feels like I'm starting it for the first time all over again, because there's always something new I'm discovering. If you're even considering getting this game, I highly suggest you do. It doesn't matter if you're a hardcore or casual gamer, if you like fantasy or not, or even if you've just never played video games before. Skyrim is one of the best games out there, and all of the good things you hear about it is true.
Hail Sithis!

184885872.review:
"Skyrim: Forge Your Destiny in a World of Infinite Possibilities"

Few games manage to capture the imagination quite like The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim. It’s not just a game—it’s a journey into a living, breathing world that invites you to explore its secrets, embrace its dangers, and carve out your own legend. Whether you’re a newcomer or a returning Dragonborn, Skyrim never ceases to amaze with its depth, freedom, and sheer sense of wonder.

From the moment you awaken as a prisoner on a cart bound for Helgen, Skyrim plunges you into a world steeped in lore and mystery. Set in the rugged, frostbitten northern province of Tamriel, the game immerses you in the Nordic culture, where ancient traditions, divine prophecies, and the shadow of civil war shape the land and its people. The open world is where this game truly shines, offering you the freedom to follow—or ignore—the call of destiny. You’re the Dragonborn, destined to battle Alduin, the World-Eater, but whether you heed this prophecy or venture off into your own adventures is entirely up to you.

This freedom of choice is the essence of Skyrim. After the introduction, you’re left to your own devices, free to decide who you want to be and what path you want to take. You could become a hero of the people, slaying dragons and helping the needy, or dive into the darker side of the world, joining the Thieves Guild in Riften or the Dark Brotherhood for a life of secrecy and assassinations. Or maybe you prefer a simpler life—spending your time crafting weapons, enchanting gear, and living the quiet life of a trader or alchemist. Want to ignore all of that and just wander the wilderness, chasing sunsets and exploring forgotten ruins? Skyrim welcomes that too.

For returning players, there’s a comfort in the familiarity of places like Whiterun, Solitude, and the foreboding depths of Blackreach. Yet, even after years of playing, the game still finds ways to surprise you. The worldbuilding is second to none, and every corner of the map feels alive with history. Ancient ruins tell stories of the fallen Dwemer and their mysterious disappearance, while the powerful Daedric Princes tempt you with their artifacts in exchange for morally questionable tasks. Every playthrough reveals something new, whether it’s a hidden dungeon, an unmarked quest, or a random encounter that makes you pause and marvel at the game’s depth.

The visuals, though dated by today’s standards, still hold a timeless charm. Towering mountains, rolling plains, and icy tundras create a world that feels vast yet personal. The night sky is one of my favorite details, painted with vibrant auroras and constellations that make you want to stop and just take it all in. Add in the hauntingly beautiful score composed by Jeremy Soule, and you have a game that delivers both visually and emotionally. The music, from the triumphant "Dragonborn" theme to the calming exploration tracks, is a soundtrack that will stick with you long after you’ve closed the game.

For those new to Skyrim, I recommend diving into the base game first to experience its charm. But for returning players, the real magic lies in its modding potential. I use Nexus Mods, where the community has created an endless array of mods that breathe new life into the game. You can enhance the graphics to modern standards, add dynamic combat systems, or even introduce entirely new quests and mechanics. Personally, I recommend downgrading to version 1.6.640 for the best mod compatibility. Just be sure to disable Steam updates and launch the game through Vortex or your preferred mod manager. With the right mods, you can transform Skyrim into a next-gen RPG or tailor it to your unique playstyle.

But even without mods, Skyrim remains an unforgettable experience. The game’s replayability is unmatched thanks to the sheer number of builds and playstyles you can create. One playthrough might see you as a battle-hardened warrior shouting enemies off cliffs with Unrelenting Force, while another might focus on a stealthy archer who eliminates threats from the shadows. Or perhaps you’d like to wield the arcane powers of a mage, mastering Destruction spells to rain fire and ice upon your foes. The choice is yours, and every choice feels impactful.

What truly sets Skyrim apart, though, is its respect for the player’s agency. It doesn’t tell you what to do or how to play. Instead, it provides a rich, immersive world and trusts you to find your own path. Your character is a blank slate, and your actions determine who they become—whether a hero, a villain, or something entirely in between.

For those returning to Tamriel, Skyrim will feel like coming home, yet still filled with new possibilities. For newcomers, it’s an adventure that will capture your imagination and refuse to let go. Whether you’re here to shout at dragons, get lost in the vast wilderness, or shape the world to your liking with mods, Skyrim is a game that has stood the test of time and continues to deliver unforgettable experiences.

If you’re looking for a game that combines freedom, exploration, and storytelling with limitless potential for creativity, Skyrim is a masterpiece you don’t want to miss. Highly recommended for both new adventurers and seasoned Dragonborn.

Its Skyrim. Already had this game on Xbox, bought it on PC too.
The game is immersive, has a fantastic sound track and still looks good 13 years later. You can be what ever you choose to be and the game will reward you for it. Including my time on console, I've spent over 1000 hours on this game and I will most likely spend a 1000 more.
It has a few quirks like the bugs, the floaty combat and a few unbalanced mechanics (stealth archer says hi) but ultimately the game pulls you in like nothing else to where you may not even notice these issues.

Additionally, don't forget the mods. If there's something in the game you wish to change, there will be a mod (or possibly 100s of mods) that can do that. Rework the combat, full retextures for everything in the game, new perk trees, spells and equipment and brand new, DLC sized quests and new lands mods. If you can imagine it, you can probably find a mod for it.

If you haven't already played this game, there's no reason not to try it. An excellent game, even unmodded. if you put the time into getting your mods just so, it can be one of the greatest games ever made.

184865537.review:
После 147 часов, проведённых в Skyrim, я могу сказать одно: эта игра — нечто поистине легендарное. Это не просто игра, а целая вселенная, которая захватывает и не отпускает.

Мир Skyrim потрясает своим масштабом, свободой и возможностями. Кажется, будто ты не просто играешь, а действительно живёшь в этом мире. Можно отправиться куда угодно, делать то, что хочется, и быть кем угодно — от великого героя-драконорожденного до простого путника, исследующего неизведанные земли.

Эта свобода выбора — главная сила игры. Каждый квест, каждая локация погружает тебя в невероятную атмосферу, а мелочи вроде разговоров жителей, звуков природы и эпичных боёв с драконами делают Skyrim живым. Здесь чувствуешь себя частью огромного мира, полного приключений и тайн.

Эмоции от прохождения были невероятными. Skyrim — это игра, которую можно назвать "избранной". Это не просто развлечение, это опыт, который оставляет след. Я ни капли не жалею о времени, потраченном на её прохождение. Это была настоящая жизнь, наполненная открытиями, сражениями и незабываемыми моментами.

Итог: Skyrim — это шедевр, который невозможно забыть.

184841577.review:
Blatant Dark Souls 2 Ripoff, Obviously. Still Good though.

Skyrim, despite being a blatant ripoff of Dark Souls 2, fails to match the latter's brilliance in almost every regard. Both games feature sprawling, atmospheric worlds and allow players to create their own path through quests and exploration. However, Skyrim’s world feels more open and less intricately interconnected than Dark Souls 2’s tightly crafted environment. While Skyrim allows for a vast amount of freedom, Dark Souls 2 delivers a much more deliberate, purposeful design where every area and enemy is meticulously placed. Skyrim’s world, for all its beauty, often feels like a collection of disconnected parts rather than a cohesive, carefully planned universe like the one in Dark Souls 2.

In terms of gameplay, Skyrim's combat is nowhere near as nuanced or challenging as Dark Souls 2’s. The combat in Skyrim, while fun, is often reduced to quick, flashy actions with little consequence. It’s easy to overpower enemies with the right build, making it a more casual experience. Dark Souls 2, in contrast, punishes players for every misstep and requires precise, thoughtful engagement with its combat system. Each encounter in Dark Souls 2 is a battle of wits, with enemies that demand careful strategy and perfect timing, creating a deep sense of accomplishment. Skyrim’s difficulty, while adjustable, never quite reaches the level of Dark Souls 2’s relentless challenge, making it feel more forgiving and less impactful overall.

That being said, Skyrim still manages to be a good game in its own right. Its massive open world, freedom of choice, and the wealth of quests and lore provide a rich, enjoyable experience for players looking for a more laid-back RPG. The ability to mod the game and tailor the experience to personal preferences ensures its longevity, and the diverse character progression system allows for significant customization. While Skyrim may have borrowed heavily from Dark Souls 2, and falls short in comparison to its depth, difficulty, and design, it’s still a fun and rewarding game that has earned its place in gaming history. Ultimately, Dark Souls 2 remains the superior title, but Skyrim still provides plenty of enjoyment for those seeking an accessible and expansive world to explore.

Skyrim is the greatest game ever made. I don't think any game has held a place in so many people's hearts for so long, and it all comes down to the world. Growing up, I played the original game on my ps3, and ended up getting a pc just so I could play Skyrim modded (yes, it's that good). Modding the game is a whole new amazing adventure that is practically another ten games in one, but the sole idea that you can customize the already brilliant game to your liking and improve upon it with your own community-made mods is awesome, and the mod authors deserve applause much in the same way the developers do. 

Skyrim is always there when you need to step away from the real world a little bit, it's an incredible experience with so many fun quests to play through, incredible characters to meet, and places to explore. You always find something new, and I don't think any other game has ever come close to the feeling of being forced to do nothing but encouraged to do everything. 

Skyrim is not only the greatest game ever made, but a testament to the human spirit.

184817680.review:
A Player's Reflection on the Masterpiece That Is Skyrim

As a long-time gamer and a passionate fan of open-world RPGs, I can confidently say that "The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" is not just a game; it's an experience that has left a lasting impact on me. Released in 2011, this iconic title from Bethesda Game Studios has stood the test of time and continues to be one of my all-time favorites. Here’s my comprehensive review of why Skyrim is such an extraordinary game.

Immersive World-Building

From the moment I stepped into the snow-covered landscape of Skyrim, I was captivated by its breathtaking beauty. The world is vast and meticulously crafted, with towering mountains, dense forests, and serene lakes that feel alive. Each region has its own unique atmosphere and charm, whether it’s the icy peaks of the Throat of the World or the lush greenery of Falkreath. The attention to detail is astounding, with dynamic weather patterns and a day-night cycle that adds depth to the experience. I often found myself simply wandering through the landscape, taking in the sights and sounds, feeling as if I were truly part of this enchanting world.

Rich Lore and Engaging Storylines

Skyrim’s lore is one of its greatest strengths. The rich history of Tamriel is woven into every quest, character, and location. The main storyline, centered around the return of dragons and the prophecy of Alduin, is compelling and filled with twists that kept me on the edge of my seat. However, what truly impressed me were the countless side quests that brought the world to life. Each faction—the Thieves Guild, the Dark Brotherhood, and the Companions—has its own unique narrative arc that adds layers to the overall story. I felt a genuine connection to the characters I encountered, each with their own struggles and motivations.

Character Customization and Freedom

One of the aspects I adore about Skyrim is the freedom it offers in character customization. From the very beginning, I was able to create a character that truly reflected my playstyle and preferences. Whether I wanted to be a stealthy archer or a powerful mage, the game provided me with endless options for skills and abilities. The leveling system is rewarding, allowing me to develop my character in a way that felt personal and unique. I loved experimenting with different builds and discovering how they influenced my gameplay experience.

Endless Exploration and Activities

Skyrim is a game that rewards exploration. There are countless dungeons to delve into, hidden treasures to uncover, and secrets to discover. I often found myself getting lost in the world, stumbling upon ancient ruins or encountering random events that led to unexpected adventures. The variety of side activities—from crafting potions and enchanting weapons to hunting wildlife—ensured that there was never a dull moment. I could easily spend hours just wandering around, engaging with the environment and its inhabitants.

Modding Community: A New Dimension

Another reason why Skyrim remains relevant years after its release is its vibrant modding community. The ability to install mods has transformed my experience in countless ways. Whether it’s enhancing graphics for a more immersive feel or adding new quests and characters, mods have breathed new life into the game. I’ve spent hours exploring user-created content that has expanded the world even further, allowing me to tailor my experience to fit my preferences perfectly.

Conclusion: A Timeless Classic
In conclusion, "The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" is more than just a game; it’s a masterpiece that has redefined what an open-world RPG can be. Its stunning visuals, rich lore, deep character customization, and endless exploration opportunities make it a timeless classic that continues to resonate with players around the world. As I reflect on my journey through Skyrim, I feel grateful for the adventures I've experienced and the memories I've created. This game will always hold a special place in my heart, and I know that I will return to its enchanting landscapes time and time again. Whether you’re a seasoned adventurer or new to the world of Tamriel, Skyrim offers an unforgettable experience that should not be missed.

Skyrim é mais do que um jogo, é uma jornada que te marca de verdade. Foram quase 500 horas explorando cada canto de Tamriel e, mesmo depois de tanto tempo, eu sempre volto. Sempre tem uma nova build pra testar, um mod que muda tudo ou simplesmente um novo recomeço que faz a experiência parecer fresca de novo. Até tomo cuidado no YouTube porque, se eu me descuidar, do nada estou novamente instalando o jogo pra montar uma nova run com um Khajiit que derruba dragões no soco ou outra maluquice qualquer.

Skyrim não é só sobre completar missões ou derrotar dragões: é sobre se perder nesse mundo e criar sua própria história. Seja se aventurar nas montanhas, curtir a paz na sua própria casa, ser vampiro, conquistar o Shadowmere ou simplesmente se perder numa das dezenas de quests únicas que te prendem de um jeito que nenhum outro jogo me prendeu. Cada detalhe do jogo te transporta pra um lugar onde o tempo passa de um jeito diferente.

A trilha sonora, as paisagens, os personagens, a evolução, os desafios...tudo isso cria uma atmosfera tão envolvente que você nem percebe as horas passarem. E essa é a magia de Skyrim: ele te faz querer voltar sempre, como se ainda houvesse algo novo a descobrir, mesmo depois de tantas horas.

184785499.review:
Wracamy do klasyków gatunku... Skyrim to gra, która urzekła mnie swoją starą, jednak nadaj zaskakującą i zapierającą dech w piersiach grafiką. Ścieżka dźwiękowa nie ma sobie nic do zarzucenia - świetna. Wielki otwarty świat, mnogość misji pobocznych oraz głównych, interakcja z NPCtami, zróżnicowane lokacje oraz różne interesujące przedmioty to kolejne mocne strony tej produkcji. Warto wspomnieć również o systemie ulepszania swojej postaci, klasach bohaterów, rozbudowanym kreatorze postaci oraz wielu mechanikach gry. 

Co do wad... Fabuła, a dokładniej jej brak. Gra oferuje nam jedynie wycinki historii bohaterów i lokacji, słabo rozbudowaną fabułę główną, czy wiele nierozwiązanych lub nieznaczących wątków. Kolejnym wielkim problemem gry są jej błędy - renderowanie świata, blokowanie w różnych miejscach... Jest też system walki, który na pewno nie zadowoli graczy produkcji takich jak Dark Souls I, II, III Elder Ring Sekiro czy też takich, którzy poszukują specyficznych mechanik broni i zbroi. Ta produkcja oferuje jedynie podstawę posługiwania mieczem, tarczą i magią ze wzbogaceniami w postaci umiejętności, które możemy rozwinąć. 

Podsumowując - gra jak najbardziej na plus. Oferuje nam piękny otwarty świat kosztem walk i fabuły. Czy warto? Musicie sprawdzić juz sami.

184769750.review:
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition é, sem dúvidas, um marco no gênero RPG e um dos títulos mais incríveis já lançados. Seu conteúdo é extremamente vasto, oferecendo diversas horas de gameplay com missões, equipamentos, personagens, subtramas e eventos que tornam o mundo vivo e cheio de possibilidades. O mapa é gigantesco, repleto de locais fascinantes para explorar, o que incentiva a curiosidade dos jogadores em cada canto de Skyrim. Além disso, a história principal é rica e bem elaborada, com tramas complexas que se entrelaçam e se expandem de forma fascinante.

Apesar de ter sido atualizado com a Special Edition, alguns aspectos envelheceram mal, como a jogabilidade em certos momentos, que pode parecer desatualizada para padrões modernos. Além disso, mesmo após várias melhorias, o jogo ainda apresenta muitos bugs, alguns dos quais podem, infelizmente, impossibilitar o progresso na história ou missões. Ainda assim, o charme e a imersão oferecidos pelo jogo superam esses problemas para a maioria dos jogadores.

O gráfico, considerando sua época de lançamento, ainda consegue impressionar com a atualização da Special Edition, que trouxe melhorias visuais notáveis e maior estabilidade. No entanto, o maior trunfo de Skyrim continua sendo sua capacidade de proporcionar uma experiência única e inesquecível, consolidando-o como um dos melhores RPGs de sua década e um título indispensável para qualquer amante do gênero.

184768735.review:
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim es un juego realmente notable con mucho que ofrecer. Aquí hay algunos aspectos destacados de lo que me gusta y algunas áreas que podrían mejorarse:

Lo que me ha gustado de Skyrim
Mundo Abierto Inmenso:

La capacidad de explorar un vasto mundo lleno de montañas, ciudades, mazmorras y paisajes diversos es simplemente impresionante. Cada rincón tiene algo nuevo por descubrir.

Libertad y Flexibilidad:

Puedes elegir cómo quieres jugar, ya sea como un guerrero, un mago, un ladrón o una combinación de todos. La libertad para tomar decisiones y ver cómo afectan el mundo es uno de los mayores atractivos del juego.

Misiones y Tramas:

Las historias y misiones secundarias son profundas y variadas, lo que hace que el juego sea mucho más que solo la misión principal. Hay personajes memorables y giros inesperados en la trama.

Modding Community:

La comunidad de modding para Skyrim es increíblemente activa, lo que permite a los jugadores personalizar y expandir el juego de formas casi infinitas.

Lo que podría mejorarse
Bugs y Glitches:

Aunque Skyrim es un juego fantástico, tiene su cuota de bugs y glitches, algunos de los cuales pueden ser frustrantes. Afortunadamente, muchos de estos se pueden solucionar con mods o actualizaciones.

Gráficos en Consolas:

Comparado con la versión de PC, las versiones de consola pueden sentirse un poco menos impresionantes gráficamente. Sin embargo, las ediciones mejoradas han abordado muchos de estos problemas.

IA de los NPCs:

La inteligencia artificial de los personajes no jugables (NPCs) a veces puede ser predecible o limitada, lo que puede afectar la inmersión en el juego.

¿Lo Recomiendo?
¡Absolutamente! Skyrim es un juego que ofrece una experiencia rica y envolvente para casi cualquier tipo de jugador. La combinación de un vasto mundo abierto, una jugabilidad flexible y una historia cautivadora hace que valga la pena explorarlo. Además, con la enorme cantidad de mods disponibles, las posibilidades son prácticamente infinitas.

184763614.review:
Dungeon crawling simulator. Vast majority of quests consist of going to an X (a certain type of dungeon) to fight through multiple dungeon levels full of Y (a certain race of enemies) to fetch a Z (random item the quest giver can't live without). At times, this would be something you can almost live with, if only the combat wasn't such a boring button mashfest. Stand in front of the enemy and spam attacks till he dies. No tactics needed. Switch to healing spells from time to time. If the enemy is strong, tab to inventory to instantly heal yourself with potions. Rinse and repeat.   

Only in Skyrim can your colleague randomly initiate radiant chitchat with you while you're both standing in front of an Emperor in his death throes since the food you've just served him at a banquet was poisoned. All the time, I'm worried whether I'm going to somehow break the delicate chain of scripting or dialogue that creates the Skyrim's boring slog of quests. Since there are no cutscenes, NPCs are usually just standing around uttering dialogue lines that can be broken by just initiating a conversation with them.  

The world is utterly lifeless. Almost nothing you do in the game world really makes a difference in it. Feels like everything happens in a bubble - Guild master in one city? Cool, you move on to the next and forget all about it - you and everyone else. You can ignore every quest at almost every stage indefinitely and nothing happens. There's zero urgency to do anything in the game. Some people call it an entertaining sandbox, I'd rather call it lack of immersion. 

Oh, and the constant loading screens.

Probably the only thing I love about this game is its soundtrack. Really cool. 

I'm sure it has been said before, but the game is as vast as an ocean, but as shallow as a puddle. This is my 3rd and last playthrough. I didn't finish the one before, and I probably won't finish this one either.

184763574.review:
I have played this game about five years ago already, but I'm finally mature enough to provide an official rewiev.
Having played the fourth part beforehand, I could see that this is a legitimate continuing to the story. Not only that, it takes all the errors and functions of the fourth part and fixes or improves them. And as many say, even if you haven't played any of the other games before, it is not a problem with this series, as I have also completed part four first and have still enjoyed the story very much.
My only complaint is the dialogue system. Not the dialogues themselves, but the way they are clicked upon. Simply clicking on the line you want to say (like you could in the earlier parts) is often (not always, which is the most confusing) not enough; you have to scroll with the scroll button (duh) to the dialogue to be pointed at with the arrow in the middle of the screen. This is certainly not a game-breaking bug, just slightly annoying.
Skyrim is found on a game shop, but it's not just a game; it's art, not only evoking emotions, but also making you feel strong opinions for or against certain sides in multiple conflicts (like the civil war between the Empire and the Stormcloaks). It is a musical treasure trove which has given me my favourite song to play on the piano (seriously, the "Dragonborn theme" sounds very good). And therefore, I give it a confident 10/10, even though there is a mistake or two. After all, there is no such a thing as a perfect game (who knows? Maybe part six [if it comes out] will prove me wrong).

184763254.review:
Engaging, responsive combat with a multitude of equally-viable and enjoyable playstyles.
A gripping storyline that will have you wishing you could forget it just to experience it anew.
A living, breathing open world filled with unique locations, bustling cities and interesting characters...

...Skyrim has none of those things. What Skyrim does have is a large playground for you to play in. The world is vast, if somewhat empty and repetitive.  Though lots of people justifiably treat the game as a stealth archer simulator, there are other character development paths - they work, and they can be fun, too. The game has some interesting side quests and a lot of deep lore if you choose to seek it out. The leveling system is intuitive and fun, though definitely not free of exploits and imbalances. Mostly, Skyrim gives you lots of stuff to do - fighting, monster-hunting, spelunking, alchemy, crafting, collecting, trading, home-building, fishing, to name a few. To see all that Skyrim has to offer, you'd need to sink way over a hundred hours into the game. But because many of the game's systems lack depth, you might be left feeling underwhelmed from the experience. Sometimes, less is more. Still, Skyrim's many avenues for exploration are there if you choose to interact with them, so most players should find something appealing.

Also I should probably mention that Skyrim becomes a completely different game with mods, but I'm not reviewing mods here, am I?

Skyrim just (barely) works. 6/10.

184727580.review:
Le roi Arthur, ou Arthur Pendragon, est, d'après les romances médiévales, un seigneur breton qui aurait organisé la défense des peuples celtes des îles Britanniques et de Bretagne armoricaine face aux envahisseurs germaniques à la fin du Ve siècle ou au début du VIe siècle. La légende d'Arthur est principalement inspirée par le folklore1 et l'invention littéraire, et son existence historique n'est pas attestée. Les sources historiques sont recueillies sur de rares textes contradictoires, essentiellement des poèmes et contes en langue galloise, des annales et chroniques décrivant la romanisation et la christianisation de la Grande-Bretagne comme les Annales Cambriae et l'Historia Brittonum et la vie des premiers saints de l'île bretonne, comme Gildas le Sage. Le nom d'Arthur apparaît également dans d'anciens poèmes tel que le Y Gododdin. Son histoire se situe à une époque où le terme « Bretagne » désignait la grande moitié sud de l'actuelle Grande-Bretagne.

La figure légendaire d'Arthur s'est développée essentiellement grâce à la Historia regum Britanniae (« Histoire des rois de Bretagne ») écrite par Geoffroy de Monmouth au XIIe siècle. Toutefois, antérieurement à cette œuvre, certains contes et poèmes gallois ou bretons, ainsi que des chroniques ou annales reprenant des traditions orales, font déjà apparaître Arthur comme un grand guerrier défendant la Bretagne des hommes et d'ennemis surnaturels ou comme une figure magique du folklore, parfois associée à Annwvyn, l'autre monde celtique. La part du récit de Geoffroy de Monmouth, écrit encore en latin, adapté des sources antérieures, et celle issue de son imagination sont inconnues.

Bien que les thèmes, les événements et les personnages de la légende du roi Arthur varient considérablement de texte en texte, et qu'il n'existe pas de version unique, les événements contés dans la Historia regum Britanniae ont servi de base pour la plupart des histoires postérieures.

Geoffroy de Monmouth dépeint Arthur comme un roi ayant établi un empire rassemblant toute l'île de Bretagne, ainsi que l'Irlande, l'Islande, la Norvège, le Danemark et une bonne partie de la Gaule. En fait, beaucoup d'éléments qui font désormais partie intégrante de l'histoire du roi Arthur apparaissent dans la Historia regum Britanniae : le père d'Arthur Uther Pendragon, Merlin l'Enchanteur, l'épée Excalibur, la naissance d'Arthur à Tintagel, sa dernière bataille contre Mordred à Camlann et sa retraite finale à Avalon.

Au XIIe siècle, l'écrivain français Chrétien de Troyes y ajoute Lancelot du Lac et le Saint Graal et crée le genre de la romance arthurienne (en puisant dans la matière de Bretagne), qui devient un domaine important de la littérature médiévale. Dans ces histoires, la narration se concentre souvent sur d'autres personnages, tels que les différents chevaliers de la Table ronde, au lieu de se focaliser sur le roi Arthur. La littérature arthurienne a prospéré pendant le Moyen Âge, avant de perdre de l'importance dans les siècles qui suivent. Elle est redevenue un sujet à la mode depuis le XIXe siècle. Au XXIe siècle, le roi Arthur est toujours un personnage mis en scène, à la fois dans la littérature mais aussi dans les adaptations scéniques (festivals, spectacles vivants), au théâtre, au cinéma, à la télévision, dans les bandes dessinées, et d'autres médias.

Origine du nom
Le prénom Arthur était en rapport étymologique avec le nom celtique de l'ours, « artos » signifiant à la fois « ours » et « guerrier ». On rapproche son nom avec celui de la déesse ourse Artio. Arthur s'expliquerait par *Arto-rix « roi-ours » ou « roi des guerriers » par un intermédiaire latinisé *Artori(u)s2.

On remarque au VIe siècle une certaine augmentation des noms tels Arzur, Arzul', Arthus, Artus ou Arthur[réf. nécessaire] qui laisse supposer l'existence d'un personnage ayant marqué les esprits. Le nom lui-même revêt un symbole de force, de stabilité et de protection, caractères bien présents dans sa légende : c'était un homme réputé fort, posé, et, en tant que roi, garant de la sécurité de ses sujets. Dans la civilisation celtique, l'ours est avant tout l'animal emblématique de la royauté. À travers son hibernation, il marque également le rythme des saisons. Les dates de naissance et de mort d'Arthur correspondent au cycle d'hibernation de l'ours, et encadrent donc un moment Arthurien dans le royaume3.

Notons néanmoins qu'à l'époque où naît la légende arthurienne (XIIe siècle), la place de l'ours comme animal emblématique est prise par le lion4. Ainsi dans l'Historia Regum Britanniae, Arthur rêve à un combat entre un ours et un dragon. Mais Arthur est le dragon, et non l'ours.

La transcription latine basée sur cette racine celtique donnerait le nom Artorius[réf. nécessaire], ce qui appuierait l'hypothèse romaine identifiant le roi Arthur au personnage de Lucius Artorius Castus. Néanmoins l'assimilation d'Arthur à Artorius repose sur des bases très fragiles.

Le roi Arthur dans l'histoire
Les historiens restent très prudents quant à une possible existence du personnage et ont tendance à rejeter Arthur « hors de l’écriture historique sérieuse », ce qui n'a pas empêché, depuis les années 1950, de nombreux médiévistes, historiens, archéologues ou écrivains, de tenter de rendre compte des origines de la légende arthurienne5. Diverses hypothèses ont été avancées.

184688195.review: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition é um daqueles jogos que conseguem nos transportar completamente para outro mundo. Com gráficos aprimorados, suporte a mods e melhorias de desempenho, ele torna a experiência ainda mais imersiva, sem perder a essência do original. Explorar as paisagens de Skyrim, seja escalando montanhas ou passeando por cidades vibrantes, é simplesmente mágico. A trilha sonora é inesquecível, e a liberdade de escolha torna cada jornada única. Seja sua primeira vez ou uma revisita, Skyrim Special Edition é uma aventura que vale cada segundo. Nota: 10/10.

184644732.review: I can confidently say that I could not more strongly recommend any other game to fellow open world RPG lovers. This game will absolutely vacuum your time, and for good reason. There's so much it has to offer, with a vast world full of things to keep you busy. The amount of quests and places to discover is about as basic as I can put it, the immersion this game presents is unbelievable. It's like you're playing in an interactive movie, building your character however you want, sided with whoever you want for whatever cause you want. I got this on discount, but I would still say it's worth it full price. Never spent a better $10 on any game, and having loved legend of zelda: tears of the kingdom, this tops that, despite being 13 years older. Aged like fine wine and cheese

184515995.review:
TES V: Skyrim Special Edition – Remaster legendy

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition je remaster pátého dílu slavné série od Bethesdy. Hra zahrnuje základní Skyrim spolu s přídavným obsahem z DLC Dawnguard a Dragonborn, což znamená, že dostanete kompletní balíček v jedné edici. Tento remaster přináší jemně vylepšenou grafiku a optimalizaci, ale zanechává za sebou něco, co fanoušci série vnímají jako neoddělitelnou součást TES – bugy. Ty zůstávají a vytvářejí jak úsměvné momenty, tak občasné frustrace.

Pozitiva:

- Lepší grafika a optimalizace: Skyrim Special Edition nabízí vylepšené textury, osvětlení a efekty, díky čemuž je vizuální zážitek hladší a příjemnější. I když nejde o revoluci, je remaster přesto o něco atraktivnější než původní verze.
- Kompletní obsah: Mít základní hru i všechna DLC pohromadě přidává na hodnotě a umožňuje hráčům zažít plný rozsah dobrodružství v jednom balíčku.

Negativa:
- Bugy a glitche: I když jsou bugy pro některé fanoušky TES her téměř nostalgickou záležitostí, mohou být pro nováčky nebo hráče očekávající dokonale optimalizovaný zážitek frustrující. Některé situace budete muset řešit modifikacemi nebo pomocí příkazové konzole.

Celkové hodnocení:
TES V: Skyrim Special Edition přináší to nejlepší z původního Skyrimu a navíc přidává několik drobných vylepšení, která usnadňují ponoření do světa Tamrielu. Pokud jste fanouškem série, nebo si chcete Skyrim zahrát poprvé, je tento remaster dobrou volbou.

Verdikt: Doporučuji.

Short Story: My father gifted me my own PS3 when I was little because he knew how much I liked video games when me and my brothers shared a PS2. One day an employee pointed out Skyrim for me and my dad but it was labeled as M for mature but it had horses and that was all I cared about, thankfully my dad got me this game for that alone. When I started up the game I looked for the first horse I could get and when I finally came to Whitrun and saw that a horse was 1000 septims. I knew what I had to do for my very own horse, this set me off and opened me up to what Skyrim had to offer than just horses. 

I love this game and have been playing since it was released on the PS3, Xbox one and finally PC. This game has given me so much joy and wonder while growing up. I have found a genuine love for fantasy games and movies. Even though this game was released a long while ago, I still love what this game gave to me and many others.

Junto com Minecraft, Skyrim é um dos poucos jogos que realmente me chamam de tempos em tempos. É como se uma necessidade surgisse de retornar, criar um novo personagem e dar início a uma nova história. Curiosamente, nunca terminei a campanha principal, mas jogo desde os tempos do Xbox 360 e pretendo continuar enquanto puder. Apesar dos problemas e bugs, considero Skyrim um dos melhores e mais memoráveis jogos que já experimentei.

O jogo é incrivelmente divertido no vanilla, mas se transforma em algo ainda mais especial com mods. Seja para corrigir falhas, melhorar a imersão ou simplesmente adicionar toques de humor, como transformar os dragões no Thomas, o Trem, os mods tornam a experiência única. Minha meta é finalizar a campanha este ano e, quando isso acontecer, atualizarei esta avaliação.

184445000.review:
After 144 hours spread over 7 years of countless new playthroughs i have finally managed to not only complete the main storyline, but the dawnguard expansion as well. How did i manage to do it this time after so many failed attempts?

Its quite simple, I took a left turn.

Instead of following the intended path after escaping Helgen and turning right into RIverwood i decided to take a left. Instead of being faced with the same story beats and dungeons that I have grown familiar  with i set out on a new path, completely changing my experience with the game. Almost instantly I met a new NPC who told me off the Bards College in Solitude, I slaughtered him for his clothes and set out for Solitude on foot to join the bards. On this journey i found locations that I never had before and I could truly enjoy the scenery as i walked the roads of Skyrim.

Seing the whole game in a different light gave me the energy to push through the game until I finally managed to beat Alduin with my trusty axe wielding character Gus. In a moment where other games would have rolled the credits I was faced with only the roars of dragons and their fiery breaths I realised that all my other characters that I had made over the years weren't failures just because they hadn't reached the end of one of the games storylines, they all told their own stories, no matter how anti-climatic their ends.

I now see how it is possible for a person to spend thousands of hours in this game, you can actually become anyone and do anything like i've always heard but failed to see.

as an ending I'd like to apologise for the long and pretentious review but this game really means alot to me, and to the friends who introduced me to this beauty I would like to thank you and I hope you're well,

There are moments when I hear "Secunda" playing in the background of random videos, and in an instant, I'm overwhelmed by a wave of nostalgia that pulls me back to Skyrim. It’s almost as if the game calls to me, urging me to boot it up and take a leisurely walk through its snow-capped mountains and vast plains, just to let the memories sink in.

Skyrim is, without a doubt, my favorite game of all time. I still remember picking up the physical copy back in 2011, a moment I’ll never forget. Since then, I’ve bought it on countless platforms, through every re-release and edition, just so I can always be ready to return home. Each time that emotional wave hits, I know Skyrim will be waiting for me, timeless and always welcoming.

There’s something magical about this game—the world feels alive, the stories never grow old, and the sense of freedom is unparalleled. Skyrim isn't just a game; it’s a place I go to recharge, relive epic moments, and escape. It has a special place in my heart, and no matter how many years pass, it will always be my home.

[h1]Spoiler do veredito: compre, mas compre numa boa promoção![/h1]
[i]Você vai gastar horas jogando e pensando "hm, falta alguma coisa". Aí vai gastar mais horas baixando mods e jogando um Skyrim completamente novo, talvez com sabre de luz.[/i]

Skyrim é aquele jogo que te faz perder a noção do tempo. Lutar contra dragões, adotar crianças (sim, você pode fazer isso) e embarcar em aventuras épicas é só o começo. A IA dos NPCs pode ser meio… estranha (alguém programou isso com café demais?), e os bugs são quase parte do charme, com cavalos voando ou NPCs fazendo parkour onde não deveriam, mas quem liga?

A verdadeira diversão está nos mods. Com a comunidade cuidando do jogo, resolvendo problemas e criando de tudo, o jogo vira praticamente qualquer coisa que você quiser – até um The Sims. Além disso, Skyrim te deixa viver a vida do seu jeito, seja como um herói, um comerciante ou um besta. A liberdade é absurda!

Skyrim é um clássico, mesmo com falta de tradução oficial em PT-BR (sério, Bethesda?). Se você curte RPG e liberdade, é só comprar e se perder nesse mundo incrível. Mas, cuidado com os mods, eles vão te fazer voltar sempre.

Recomendo muito, mas se prepare para perder horas… ou dias… ou semanas da sua vida!

184390174.review:
I was a big fan of Morrowind and Oblivion growing up and loved the Bethesda Fallouts, but somehow my interest in this game was just not there, I'm not really sure why, I think all the promotional material at the time made the game seem very grey and dull which made me disinterested. Well, if you fall in this category, just buy the game and play it, stop denying yourself one of the greatest RPGs ever made! 

The gameplay, sense of exploration, questing, NPCs, dialogue, lore, aesthetic/art direction, level progression, voice acting, build variety are all as good as anything else I have played. The game allows you to really play it how you want and do quests in what order you want. I always felt like I had a variety of stuff I could do that all interested me at all points through the game. The most random side quests can spring into these epic adventures out of nowhere which really keeps you sucked in and looking for the next quest. I always felt rewarded for exploring in this game, there is just a ridiculous amount of stuff to see and do. What else is there to say, this is an example of best in genre, it is a must play, go play it.

10/10 - Perfection, absolutely ahead of its time, and sets a high bar for current day games.

Lokir: Damn you Stormcloaks. Skyrim was fine until you came along. Empire was nice and lazy. If they hadn't been looking for you, I could've stolen that horse and been half way to Hammerfell. You there. You and me -- we should be here. It's these Stormcloaks the Empire wants.
 Ralof: We're all brothers and sisters in binds now, thief.
 Imperial Soldier: Shut up back there! [Lokir looks at the gagged man.] 
Lokir: And what's wrong with him? Ralof: Watch your tongue! You're speaking to Ulfric Stormcloak, the true High King. 
Lokir: Ulfric? The Jarl of Windhelm? You're the leader of the rebellion. But if they captured you... Oh gods, where are they taking us?
 Ralof: I don't know where we're going, but Sovngarde awaits.
 Lokir: No, this can't be happening. This isn't happening. Ralof: Hey, what village are you from, horse thief? Lokir: Why do you care?

General Tullius: Good. Let's get this over with. Lokir: Shor, Mara, Dibella, Kynareth, Akatosh. Divines, please help me.

I used to be sweet on a girl from here. Wonder if Vilod is still making that mead with juniper berries mixed in. Funny...when I was a boy, Imperial walls and towers used to make me feel so safe. 184243631.review:
[h3]Summary[/h3]
I never get tired of playing this game. The mountain scenery is just so beautiful along with the soundtrack. Experimenting with the thousands of available mods keeps the game interesting. Highly recommended for someone who enjoys customizing games and playing them in a more casual fashion.
[h3]Running on a non-gaming laptop[/h3]
The modded game plays nicely on both my ultra-wide screen gaming monitor and my laptop display. The graphics are a bit dated but the GPU load on my 13" Intel-based Macbook Pro is low enough that the game plays nicely on this non-gaming laptop.
[h3]Combat and console commands[/h3]
I'm not really into combat so the lackluster combat controls and animations in this game suits me just fine.
The console commands are very useful. Using them, I can place static objects wherever I want to customize living spaces, turn off combat altogether, change the weather at will or fly through the air like a bird.
[h3]Game activities[/h3]
There are so many activities in this game that I don't remember most of them by the time I replay the game again. It's almost like starting anew each time. It takes me 4 or 5 years to complete the game which probably means I'm not a true gamer. I started playing Skyrim SE in 2021 and I still haven't reached the end after playing thousands of hours. Obviously, completing quests is not a high priority for me. I'd rather just explore this virtual open-world without any specific goal in mind.
[h3]Playing offline[/h3]
Lastly, it runs great offline during power outages with no internet access (which happens a lot where I live in the mountains).
[h3]Caveats playing on an Intel Macbook Pro[/h3]
Some caveats when running this Special Edition (SE) game on an unsupported Intel-based Macbook Pro (running Windows 10 in the BOOTCAMP partition). I'm not sure if SE is still available on Stream but a DRM-free copy is available on GOG.

1. You need to use an external 2-button mouse. It doesn't work correctly using the Macbook's built-in touch pad. Windows 10 provides a system setting that automatically disables the touch pad whenever an external mouse is connected.

2. You need to create a virtual disk and move the sound .bsa files to the virtual disk. Then, symlink to those files from the gaming directory. If you don't do this, the soundtrack and possibly other sounds won't play due to a timing issue on Macbooks. By placing the sound .bsa files on a virtual disk, the load process is delayed through the symlink redirect just enough that the sound files load properly. That means, you have to mount the virtual disk manually before playing the game but with WIndows 10 shortcuts you can make this a simple 2-click operation.

3. When using the older 64-bit Special Edition (SE) with Skyrim SE Script Extender (SKSE), you have to launch the Stream app before launching SKSE. You also need to disable auto-update within the Steam app. If you forget to do this, Steam will auto-update to the Anniversary edition breaking SKSE and many of the SE mods in the process and you will be forced to reinstall the older SE software with your mods from a backup to get things back into a working state again.

It is possible by now that the modding community has finally caught up with the Anniversary edition so staying with the older Special Edition may no longer be necessary. But, I haven't gone to the trouble of trying that out yet.
